cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.RO

Reasoning: The paper deals with the computational complexity of finding an optimal stochastic controller in a Markov decision process, which is a problem commonly studied in the fields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the more general problem of stochastic controller optimization in partially observable Markov decision processes (POMDPs), which is a topic in control theory (cs.SY) and robotics (cs.RO). The paper's focus on computational complexity suggests that it may also be relevant to the field of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS).
